com.canabang.genietext.core.model.eventHandlers
Class ProcessorFactory

java.lang.Object
  javax.mail.event.MessageCountAdapter
      com.canabang.genietext.core.model.eventHandlers.ProcessorFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, MessageCountListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
TransitProcessorFactory
public abstract class ProcessorFactory
extends MessageCountAdapter

Generates the worker threads responsible for processing the mail request.

Version:
1.00 2009-05-12 Initial submission., 1.10 2009-05-31 Moved SMTP server parameter from constructor and moved it to a set() method so that a SMTP server does not have to be specified during construction. Also renamed the class from ProcessorGenerator to ProcessorFactory. Added address filter.
Author:
rhaq

Constructor Detail

ProcessorFactory

public ProcessorFactory(AddressSet subService,
                        DefaultListModel log,
                        AddressSet filter)
Creates an instance of the generator that will create the worker threads necessary to process the requests specified in the emails.

Parameters:
subService - The subscription service.
log - Used to log incoming requests.
filter - The set of addresses that will be filtered and not processed.
Method Detail

copyAndProcessMessage

private void copyAndProcessMessage(Message m,
                                   String addressValues)
                            throws MessagingException,
                                   IOException,
                                   ParseException,
                                   ParserConfigurationException,
                                   SAXException
Copies the specified message (for offline use) and gives to to the processor to process.

Parameters:
m - The message containing the request.
addressValues - The list of address the message was sent from as a String.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem sending the response message.
IOException - If there is a problem accessing the external resources to process the message request.
ParseException - If the contents of the requests message are not formatted properly.
SAXException - If there are any problems writing to the output XML file for subscriptions.
ParserConfigurationException - If there is a problem setting up a XML parser.

generateProcessor

public abstract RequestProcessor generateProcessor(MimeMessage m)
                                            throws MessagingException,
                                                   IOException,
                                                   ParseException,
                                                   ParserConfigurationException,
                                                   SAXException
All subclasses must implement this to specify the processor that will handle the message request.

Parameters:
m - The message that needs to be processed by the worker threads (must be a copy).
Returns:
The processor that will handle the request message.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem sending the response message.
IOException - If there is a problem accessing the external resources to process the message request.
ParseException - If the contents of the requests message are not formatted properly.
SAXException - If there are any problems writing to the output XML file for subscriptions.
ParserConfigurationException - If there is a problem setting up a XML parser.

messagesAdded in interface MessageCountListener

messagesAdded in class MessageCountAdapter

setServer

public void setServer(SmtpServer server)
Sets the SMTP server to the specified one.

Parameters:
server - The SMTP server that will be used to send the response back.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the creation of any more request processors and shuts down any currently executing ones.

getAddressValues

private static final String getAddressValues(Address[] addresses)
Assembles the list of addresses specified as a string separated by a comma.

Parameters:
addresses - The addresses to assemble and separate by commas.
Returns:
The addresses specified separated by commas (ie: arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4).

getLogRequestSignature

private static final String getLogRequestSignature(Message m,
                                                   String addressValues)
                                            throws MessagingException,
                                                   IOException
Gets the log request signature.

Parameters:
m - The message containing the request.
addressValues - The list of address the message was sent from as a String.
Returns:
the log request signature
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem sending the response message.
IOException - If there is a problem accessing the external resources to process the message request.
